subject: Programming
title: The Cost of Technical Debt
description: A 60-second lesson on The Cost of Technical Debt.

hook.text: Every shortcut in code is a loan. Technical debt charges compound interest.

buildup.text: Ward Cunningham coined the metaphor: messy code is like financial debt that slows future work.

discovery.text: Teams with high tech debt spend 40% of their time on unplanned rework instead of new features.

twist.text: Some debt is strategic â€” shipping fast to learn. The mistake is never paying it back.

climax.text: Interest compounds. Code that was 'good enough' last year becomes next year's emergency.
